author: lightclient

author: Deleted User
content: Yes, please. I was thinking about adding an extra opcode to work with the multiple signatures, but only if this is a requirement for introducing such a feature. Currently idea is to have 1 opcode, for example, `SIGNER`, which pops an argument from the stack. If argument is 0, then it pushes back the number of signers in the tx. If the argument is >0, it returns the corresponding signer. Signer with number 1 is `tx.origin`. But, of course, this makes this opcode polymorphic. In order to get rid of polymorphism, perhaps the special opcode is needed to getting the number of signers.
